recipe.name: Pork with Apples and Pears
recipe.notes: Works with chicken too. Other variation: Citrus - in step 3, omit fruit and extra stock and instead stir in 2 T lemon juice, some capers, and 2 T butter. Spoon sauce over chops and garnish with parsley.

ingredient.ingredient_name: shoulder or center cut loin pork chops, 1 inch thick
pears or apples or a combination
ingredient.preparation: peeled and cut into 1/2 inch wedges

recipe.preparation: Step 1: Sprinkle chops with salt and pepper. Put a large skillet over medium-high heat for 2 minutes. Add EVOO; when hot, add chops and turn heat to high. Brown for 2 minutes on each side. Step 2: Reduce heat to medium. Add water or wine and garlic and cook, turning chops twice, until the liquid has almost evaporated - 3 minutes. Add stock, turn heat to low, and cover, cooking until chops are tender but not dry, 10 to 15 min. (When they're done, their jucies will run slightly pink.) Step 3: Transfer pork to a platter and cover to keep warm. Add fruit wedges to the skillet, stirring and scraping the bottom of the pan. If the pan seems too dry, add another 1/2 cup stock or wine and continue cooking until the fruit is soft and the liquid is reduced slightly, 5 to 10 minutes. Spoon the fruit and sauce over the chops and garnish with parsley.
